messages.content:
The quadratic formula states that the solutions to the equation $ax^2 + bx + c = 0$ are given by

$$x = \dfrac{-b \pm \sqrt{b^2 - 4ac}}{2a}$$

In this case, we have $a = 1$, $b = -125$, and $c = 2500$. Substituting these values into the quadratic formula, we get

$$x = \dfrac{125 \pm \sqrt{(-125)^2 - 4 \cdot 1 \cdot 2500}}{2 \cdot 1}$$

$$x = \dfrac{125 \pm \sqrt{5625 - 10000}}{2}$$

$$x = \dfrac{125 \pm \sqrt{-4375}}{2}$$

$$x = \dfrac{125 \pm 5 \sqrt{173}}{2}$$

Therefore, the solutions to the equation $x^2 - 125x + 2500 = 0$ are $x = \dfrac{125 \pm 5 \sqrt{173}}{2}$.
